(2) Relationship between several languages may be due either to the fact that one is descended from the other (eg. French from Latin), or to the fact that they are all descended from a common ancestor (eg, French, Italian, Spanish, and Ronmanian, all descended from Latin).2 In the latter case, the ancestor may be known, and may have left a more or less exten· sive literature, or at any rate some written documenta, throwing light on the chief features of its grammar3 or, on the other hand, it may have perished, without leaving any trace of its existence except the languages derived from it, which it is

proposed to study.
